Class ec.util.OptionTable 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.util.OptionTable
public class OptionTable
extends Object
An OptionTable holds all the possible options for parsing with an OptionEnumeration. It merely maps the String of the option text to a Boolean indicating whether the option takes an argument.

OptionTable(String)
Construct a new OptionTable, with the given prefix.

addArg(String)
Add a new option-with-arg to the table.
addNoArg(String)
Add a new no-arg option to the table.
find(String)
Find the given key.

OptionTable 
 public OptionTable(String thePrefix)
Construct a new OptionTable, with the given prefix. The prefix must exist on a given argument for it to be considered an option.

Parameters:
thePrefix - the option prefix

addNoArg 
 public void addNoArg(String key)
Add a new no-arg option to the table.

Parameters:
key - the option key
addArg 
 public void addArg(String key)
Add a new option-with-arg to the table.

Parameters:
key - the option key
find 
 public Boolean find(String key)
Find the given key. Return the corresponding Boolean, or null if the key isn't in the table.

Parameters:
key - the option key
Returns:
a Boolean representing whether the option takes an arg or null if there is no such option.
